subject: YAPC::NA opened registration. Perl Workshops in Israel, Germany, and Switzeland

entries.text: Not a coding ninja, but want to help the Perl ecosystem? The Perl NOC needs volunteers to be mailing list helping fairies and gnomes.
entries.title: Seeking 'list-owner' help

entries.text: A new bugfix release of RT is out.
entries.title: RT 4.0.10 Released

entries.text: Documentation, lovely documention... The RT crew has been working at beefing up its documentation. Here's the fruit of their labor
entries.title: New documentation for RT

entries.text: A picture is worth a thousand words. Or, in this case, roughly a thousand new uploads to CPAN per month.
entries.title: CPAN uploads per month

entries.text: Gabor Szabo offers a refresher on how to access Perl documentation (both for core stuff and modules).
entries.title: Core Perl documentation and CPAN module documentation

entries.text: Franck Cuny is using Graphite @{$work}, and is giving us a peek at how it fits in its surrounding environment.
entries.title: Let's talk about Graphite

entries.text: Ovid gives us a idea of the TODO list for the upcoming QA Hackaton. Prepare to drool.
entries.title: QA Hackaton 2013 Laundry List

entries.text: v1.1_1, is it considered to be higher than v1.1, or lower because a trial version? Chisel wasn't sure either, and found out.
entries.title: Versioning Developer Releases

entries.text: Ricardo Signes follows up on his file finding modules performance tests of last week.
entries.title: more on the speed of file finding

entries.text: A new contender in the JUnit-type testing arena. This one is from Ovid, and throws Moose goodness in the mix.
entries.title: Test::Class::Moose on the CPAN

entries.text: So, you have those massive gzipped log files: how to plow through them in less than geological times? Sinan Unur tries to find out.
entries.title: Large gzipped files, long lines, extracting columns etc

entries.text: Parsing DOT graph files using Marpa.
entries.title: Lexing and Parsing Continued

entries.text: Yanick presents a little script that magically turns all the TODOs in your code in GitHub issues (but, alas, don't fix them for you).
entries.title: Pushing Your Code TODOs to GitHub Issues

entries.text: So, you left your blog entry directories 'grow organically', and now you want to tame the resulting unholy mess. Gabor Szabo shows us how he fought entropy with perl, grep, cut, and a good vacuum cleaner.
entries.title: Fetching the status of blog entries using grep and cut

entries.text: Path::Class is awesome, but not the fastest horse in the stabble. Consequently, here comes David Golden's Path::Tiny, with 90% of its cousin's features and a lot more speed in its hooves.
entries.title: Goodbye Path::Class, hello Path::Tiny

entries.text: New perl installed. Fire up the debugger. Ah, yes, which modules do we need to get command history in there again? Chisel found out, and wrote a small puppet update to make sure everything needed is always there.
entries.title: Command history in the perl debugger

entries.text: Mike Doherty cares about security. He has a look at the Content Security Policy proposed by Mozilla, and shows how to write a simple CSP violation tracker using Dancer.
entries.title: Planning a Content-Security-Policy with Dancer

entries.text: Mark Dootson provides fruitful information how to get Citrus Perl running on Raspberry Pi.
entries.title: Citrus on Raspberry Pi

entries.text: Joel Berger continues to toil on Alien::Base, and needs some help from CPANtesters.
entries.title: Alien::Base Grant - Report #8

entries.text: These Perl 6 decelopers unstoppable!
entries.title: Rakudo Star 2013.01 released

entries.text: If you want your head to spin, read the about the dessign work of Jonathan Worthington. In a related note and much more down to earth, Nicholas Clark reported that 'NQP JVM prototype faster than Perl 5'. (Search for his e-mail, if interested.)
entries.title: A look at the preparations behind the JVM port, and a progress update

entries.text: The one year anniversary meeting of Cluj.pm is planned to be in March.
entries.title: Call for speakers - Cluj.PM Anniversary Meet-Up

entries.text: I've updated and released the edition of the Advanced Perl book. People who already purchased (or who attended my advanced course) can download it free.
entries.title: New edition of the Advanced Perl Maven e-book was published

entries.text: February 25, 2013, Tel Aviv, Israel
entries.title: Israeli Perl-Workshop 2013 (ILPW)

entries.text: March 13-15, 2013, Berlin, Germany
entries.title: German Perl-Workshop 2013

entries.text: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland
entries.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013

entries.text: June 3-5, 2013, Austin, Texas, USA
entries.title: YAPC::NA 2013

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.

header: this edition was mostly put together by Yanick, I just added a few entries.
YAPC::NA has finally opened its web site for registration. See the link at the bottom of this edition along with the links to three Perl workshops.
